狋字的基本解释

狋
yí
狗发怒的样子。
狗相争斗。

狋
quán
〔狋氏〕中国汉代县名，在今山西省浑源县东。

狋
chí
〔狋觺〕兽角；一说不平的样子。

狋字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yí］
［《廣韻》牛肌切，平脂，疑。］
(1)犬怒貌。
(2)见“狋吽牙”。
[②]［quán］
［《廣韻》巨員切，平仙，羣。］
汉代郡有狋氏县。见《汉书·地理志下》。
[③]［chí］
见“狋3觺”。

狋字的康熙字典解释

【巳集下】【犬字部】　狋； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页708第17
【唐韻】語其切【集韻】牛肌切，?音䇵。【說文】犬怒貌。【玉篇】兩犬爭也。【前漢·東方朔傳】狋吽牙。【註】師古曰：狋，五伊切。　又【說文】一曰犬難得。　又地名。【說文】代郡有狋氏縣。　又【集韻】遵綏切，音嗺。犬怒。　又俟甾切，音漦。狋觺，獸角貌。　又一曰不平貌。　又【說文】讀若銀。【前漢·東方朔傳】狋吽牙註應劭曰：狋，音銀。　又【廣韻】巨員切【集韻】逵員切，?音權。【前漢·地理志】代郡狋氏。【註】孟康曰：狋氏，音權精。【集韻】或作獾。

考證：〔【前漢·東方朔傳】狋呼牙。又【前漢·東方朔傳】狋呼牙。【註】〕　謹照原文兩呼字?改吽。
狋字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
狋字的起名意思

暂无。

Fierce
Basic explanation of words
Fierce
yí
The dog looks angry.
Dogs fight each other.
Fierce
quán
〔狋氏〕The name of a county in Han Dynasty in China, in the east of Hunyuan County, Shanxi Province.
Fierce
chí
〔狋觺〕 horns; an appearance of injustice.
Fierce
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yí］
["Guangyun" beef muscle cut, smooth fat, suspicious. ]
(1) Dog looks angry.
(2) See "Hanging Teeth".
[②]［quán］
["Guangyun" giant cut, flat fairy, group. ]
In the Han dynasty, there is the Guishi County. See "Hanshu·Geography II".
[③] [chí]
See "Chu 3 觺".
Fierce
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Siji 2] [Dog Character Department] 　狋; Kangxi strokes: 9; Page number: page 708 17
[Tang Yun] Yu Qiqi [Jiyun] Niu muscle cut,? Yin Ji. [Said the text] The dog looks angry. [Jade articles] Two dogs compete. [Previous Han·Dongfang Shuo Biography] Grim teeth. [Note] Shi Gu said: Xi, Wu Yiqie.　[Said Wen] One said that dogs are rare.　Also place name. [Said the text] There is the Xi'an County in the Daijun County.　 [Ji Yun] Zun Sui cut, sound 嗺. Dog angry.　I'm going to cut it again, the sound is stubborn. Crouching, animal horns.　Another one said that the appearance is unfair.　[Said Wen] Read Ruo Yin. [Previous Han·Dongfang Shuo Biography] Yu Hang Ya Zhu Ying Shao said: Yu, Yin Yin.　[Guangyun] Giant member cut [Jiyun] Kui member cut, sound right. [Pre-Han Geography] Daijun Xu's family. [Note] Meng Kang said: Xi, Yin Quanjing. [Ji Yun] or as a badger. Textual research: [[Previous Han·Dongfang Shuo Chuan] Huo Huya. Also 【Previous Han·Dongfang Shuo Biography】Huya Huya. [Note]] 　 Would you like to call the words according to the original text? Change Hum.
